snippet: As family and friends ascended the steps of Menachem Stark’s brick rowhouse on Monday to pay their respects, they were abuzz with a single question: Why had he been killed?
abstract: Mourning of Menachem Stark, Hasidic real estate developer from Brooklyn who was kidnapped and killed, is not a quiet affair; as family and friends pay their respects they are abuzz with wonder over why he had been killed; leaders of the large ultra-Orthodox community in Brooklyn announce a reward of $25,000 for information leading to the capture of those responsible for his death; police continue to investigate.

byline.contributor: Reporting was contributed by Joseph Berger, J. David Goodman, Nate Schweber and Julie Turkewitz. Susan C. Beachy and Sheelagh McNeill contributed research.

lead_paragraph: As family and friends ascended the steps of Menachem Stark’s brick rowhouse on Monday to pay their respects, they were abuzz with a single question: Why had he been killed?

headline.main: Rumors Fly Among Hasidim About Abducted Man’s Death
headline.print_headline: Rumors Fly Among Hasidim About Abducted Man’s Death
